Vectors
```{R}
t <- c(2,5,7.4,9,-1,3) # numeric vector
r <- c("t","c","g", "a") # character vector
g <- c(TRUE,FALSE,TRUE,TRUE,TRUE,FALSE) #logical vector
```

Matrices
```{R}
TRGNData <- c(2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.4, 2.5, 2.6) # numeric vector
mat <- matrix(TRGNData, 2, 3) # creating a matrix
mat

mat2 <- matrix(nrow = 2, ncol = 2) # creating another matrix
mat2

dim(mat2)  # checking the dimensions of the matrix

mat2 <- matrix(c(1:3))
class(mat2)       # checking that the matrix has vectors with a class attribute

mat2 <- matrix(c(1:3))
class(mat2)
typeof(mat2)    # shows that the matrix is an integer vector
```

Other ways to construct a matrix
```{R}
mat3 <- matrix(1:6, nrow = 2, ncol = 3)

mat4 <- 1:10
dim(mat4) <- c(2, 5)
```

Another way is to bind columns or rows using cbind() and rbind().
```{R}
x <- 1:3
y <- 10:12
cbind(x, y)

rbind(x, y)
```

Using by-row argument to specify how the matrix is filled
```{R}
mat5 <- matrix(c(1, 2, 3, 11, 12, 13),
               nrow = 2,
               ncol = 3,
               byrow = TRUE)
mat5
```

Composite plots
```{R}
plot(log2(exprA), log2(exprB), col= "blue", type = "n")
for(i in which(exprA<500)) {points(log2(exprA[i]),log(exprB[i]), col="red")}
for(i in which(exprA>1000)) {points(log2(exprA[i]),log(exprB[i]), col="blue")}
for(i in which(exprA>=500 & exprA <=1000)) {points(log2(exprA[i]),log(exprB[i]), col="green")}
```

Composite plots 2
```{R}
a = 0; b = 0; c = 0;
for(i in exprA) {
  if(i<500) {a=a+1};
  if(i>1000){b=b+1}else{c=c+1}
};
barplot(c(a,b,c),
        names=c("<500",">1000","500-1000"),
        col=c("red", "blue", "green"),
        yla="Frequency")
```
